content.description: Begin on amazing rock with holds that would be much better at other angles until you reach some easy slabbing to get established under a beautiful band of quartz. Use the best hold at Russell (okay, there are a lot of best holds) to work your way right to the arete and climb your way up  perfect rock. Once you cannot move up any further, step high and right to gain the small dirt ledge where the anchor now lives (Had to move these anchors to try and make lowering off slightly easier.) Lowering off is fine but I recommend the second cleans on top rope. It has been done plenty of times cleaning on lower but there is a potential for a swing if not careful. A great warmup for doing the Winter Wall circuit. Do them all!
content.location: Furthest right climb at the Winter Wall.

content.description: This climbs the nice-looking orange wall in the center of Winter Wall. Start with a hard, V6ish boulder problem to a jug, then battle up 3 bolts of sustained 12a climbing. Topout on the midway ledge and finish on Blue Shift (5.9) to the left.
content.protection: Bolts, finish on Blue Shift and lower off.

content.description: Jojo's is about as much fun as you can have in four bolts. The movement is wonderful the holds are memorable and the rock is superb. A must do Russell crags route.Follow some bolts up the semi steep wall of overlapping and super colorful schist. The climbing is mostly juggy and the crux is encountered about halfway up at a chicken head. This section has now been done a bunch of different ways. Beta spoiler when you make it to the anchor there is a good crimp just up and right that makes clipping more casual. People will often skip or unclip the first bolt after the second is clipped. It seems to be easier to belay without it clipped.
content.location: At the top, left end of the winter wall. Jojo's shares a belay alcove with Ita's Calico Corner

content.description: This is a fun outing on really nice rock that that is sure to test at least a few skills.Ita's starts with little bit of stemming a some funky sidepulls. This section can be cruxy so be on attention and make good use of technique. This eases into a juggy corner then left to a ledge. Above the ledge some super nice crimps of varrying rock types lead up to a fun mantle and one more little section of fun climbing to the top. Find a nice quartz hold above the anchor to the left for the full effect before lowering.
content.location: The corner at the top, left end of winter wall. It's Calico like a cat.

content.description: This route can best be described as a boulder problem protected by trad gear in a sport climbing area. The boulder below it certainly presents a problem. I've seen as many as seven cams placed in all of 14 feet and there was still plenty of potential to deck. Have I got you excited yet?  Do you like hand jamming, bone torquing, awkward off width style climbing?  Honestly kinda popular as a top rope. It really is pretty fun to have a session on and eases up with good beta. There are some nice hand jams and the rock is great like the rest of the wall.Oh yeah, the boulder is "off" haha classic.
content.protection: Trad to tree or more reasonably a top rope
content.location: Right side of the winter wall. It climbs just above the problem boulder.

content.description: One of the best moderates on the hillside, Blue Shift climbs right up the center of the Winter Wall. Start in a right-facing corner and climb up this steep corner for three bolts, until you can topout on a midway ledge. From here, follow sculpted holds and pockets up a wall that looks slabby from below, but is actually pretty close to vertical. Lower off anchors high on the wall. This was sent on the day we found out the results of the 2020 election, so this and the route to the right were named in inspiration of the outcome.

Another winter wall route, another great one. Get after it!Stick clip beta it to either stick clip the first bolt and hang the second draw, or some people stick clip the first two bolts. This route starts up some nice light gray rock using a couple of good holds. After the second bolt is clipped there is a tough mantle style move. This section has been done many ways depending on height. A fun bit if climbing leads to a kinda spooky clip, another crux and steepish pull up onto way cool bulbous flakes before the anchor.
content.location: Center of winter wall. There is a slabby boulder below it.

content.description: Winter wall is just a magnificent expression of the diversity of schist. Crystals and swirls of colors, oranges and grays and whites and browns. Its layered and melted and folded and now bolted. A super fun place to climb! Do the winter wall circuit! You wont be disappointed.This area gets a lot of sun and is generally sheltered.
